datasets.name: cost_usage_daily
queryLines:
WITH usage_priced AS (
  SELECT
    u.usage_start_time,
    u.sku_name,
    u.usage_unit,
    u.usage_quantity,
    CAST(p.pricing.effective_list.default AS DOUBLE) AS unit_price
  FROM system.billing.usage u
  LEFT JOIN system.billing.list_prices p
    ON u.sku_name = p.sku_name
   AND u.usage_start_time >= p.price_start_time
   AND (u.usage_start_time < p.price_end_time OR p.price_end_time IS NULL)
  WHERE u.usage_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
)
SELECT
  date_trunc('day', usage_start_time) AS day,
  sku_name,
  SUM(CASE WHEN usage_unit = 'DBU' THEN usage_quantity ELSE 0 END) AS dbu,
  SUM(CASE WHEN usage_unit = 'DBU' THEN usage_quantity * unit_price ELSE 0 END) AS cost_usd
FROM usage_priced
GROUP BY date_trunc('day', usage_start_time), sku_name

datasets.name: job_runs_detail
queryLines:
SELECT
  jrt.account_id,
  jrt.workspace_id,
  jrt.job_id,
  jrt.run_id,
  COALESCE(j.name, jrt.run_name) AS job_name,
  jrt.run_type,
  jrt.trigger_type,
  jrt.period_start_time,
  jrt.period_end_time,
  (UNIX_TIMESTAMP(jrt.period_end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(jrt.period_start_time)) AS duration_sec,
  jrt.result_state,
  jrt.termination_code,
  jrt.compute_ids,
  jrt.job_parameters
FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline jrt
LEFT JOIN system.lakeflow.jobs j
  ON jrt.workspace_id = j.workspace_id
 AND jrt.job_id       = j.job_id
WHERE jrt.period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS

datasets.name: job_reliability_daily
queryLines:
SELECT
  job_id,
  date_trunc('day', period_start_time) AS day,
  COUNT(*) AS runs,
  SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(result_state) = 'SUCCESS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS succeeded_runs,
  SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(result_state) = 'FAILED'  THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS failed_runs,
  CASE WHEN COUNT(*) = 0 THEN NULL
       ELSE SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(result_state) = 'SUCCESS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(*)
  END AS success_rate,
  percentile_approx(
    UNIX_TIMESTAMP(period_end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(period_start_time),
    0.95
  ) AS p95_duration_sec
FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
WHERE period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
GROUP BY job_id, date_trunc('day', period_start_time)

datasets.name: job_task_mix
queryLines:
SELECT
  jt.job_id,
  jt.task_key,
  date_trunc('day', t.period_start_time) AS day,
  COUNT(*) AS task_runs,
  AVG(UNIX_TIMESTAMP(t.period_end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(t.period_start_time)) AS avg_task_duration_sec
FROM system.lakeflow.job_tasks jt
JOIN system.lakeflow.job_task_run_timeline t
  ON t.workspace_id = jt.workspace_id
 AND t.job_id       = jt.job_id
 AND t.task_key     = jt.task_key
WHERE t.period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
GROUP BY jt.job_id, jt.task_key, date_trunc('day', t.period_start_time)

datasets.name: pipeline_updates_detail
queryLines:
SELECT
  put.pipeline_id,
  p.name AS pipeline_name,
  put.update_id,
  put.update_type,
  put.trigger_type,
  put.period_start_time,
  put.period_end_time,
  (UNIX_TIMESTAMP(put.period_end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(put.period_start_time)) AS duration_sec,
  put.result_state
FROM system.lakeflow.pipeline_update_timeline put
LEFT JOIN system.lakeflow.pipelines p
  ON put.workspace_id = p.workspace_id
 AND put.pipeline_id  = p.pipeline_id
WHERE put.period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS

datasets.name: pipeline_reliability_daily
queryLines:
SELECT
  pipeline_id,
  date_trunc('day', period_start_time) AS day,
  COUNT(*) AS updates,
  SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(result_state) = 'SUCCESS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS succeeded_updates,
  SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(result_state) = 'FAILED'  THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS failed_updates,
  CASE WHEN COUNT(*) = 0 THEN NULL
       ELSE SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(result_state) = 'SUCCESS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(*)
  END AS success_rate,
  percentile_approx(
    UNIX_TIMESTAMP(period_end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(period_start_time),
    0.95
  ) AS p95_update_duration_sec
FROM system.lakeflow.pipeline_update_timeline
WHERE period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
GROUP BY pipeline_id, date_trunc('day', period_start_time)

datasets.name: warehouse_uptime_daily
queryLines:
WITH events AS (
  SELECT
    warehouse_id,
    event_time,
    event_type,
    LEAD(event_time) OVER (PARTITION BY warehouse_id ORDER BY event_time) AS next_time
  FROM system.compute.warehouse_events
  WHERE event_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
)
SELECT
  warehouse_id,
  date_trunc('day', event_time) AS day,
  SUM(CASE WHEN event_type = 'RUNNING'
           THEN COALESCE(UNIX_TIMESTAMP(next_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(event_time), 0)
           ELSE 0 END) / 86400.0 AS running_ratio
FROM events
GROUP BY warehouse_id, date_trunc('day', event_time)

datasets.name: node_utilization_hourly
queryLines:
SELECT
  cluster_id,
  instance_id,
  date_trunc('hour', start_time) AS hour,
  AVG(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) AS avg_cpu_percent,
  AVG(mem_used_percent) AS avg_mem_percent
FROM system.compute.node_timeline
WHERE start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 7 DAYS
GROUP BY cluster_id, instance_id, date_trunc('hour', start_time)

datasets.name: query_history_detail
queryLines:
SELECT
  statement_id,
  compute.warehouse_id   AS warehouse_id,
  executed_by            AS user_email,
  start_time,
  end_time,
  (UNIX_TIMESTAMP(end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(start_time)) * 1000 AS duration_ms,
  read_rows,
  produced_rows,
  execution_status,
  error_message,
  MD5(COALESCE(statement_text,'')) AS statement_text_hash
FROM system.query.history
WHERE start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS

datasets.name: query_p95_daily
queryLines:
SELECT
  compute.warehouse_id AS warehouse_id,
  date_trunc('day', start_time) AS day,
  percentile_approx(
    (UNIX_TIMESTAMP(end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(start_time)) * 1000,
    0.95
  ) AS p95_duration_ms,
  SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(execution_status) = 'FAILED' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS failed_queries
FROM system.query.history
WHERE start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
GROUP BY compute.warehouse_id, date_trunc('day', start_time)

datasets.name: cost_attribution_daily
queryLines:
SELECT
  CASE
    WHEN u.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL THEN 'JOB'
    WHEN u.usage_metadata.dlt_pipeline_id IS NOT NULL THEN 'PIPELINE'
    WHEN u.usage_metadata.warehouse_id IS NOT NULL THEN 'WAREHOUSE'
    ELSE 'OTHER'
  END AS object_type,
  COALESCE(
    u.usage_metadata.job_id,
    u.usage_metadata.dlt_pipeline_id,
    u.usage_metadata.warehouse_id,
    'N/A'
  ) AS object_id,
  date_trunc('day', u.usage_start_time) AS day,
  SUM(CASE WHEN u.usage_unit = 'DBU'
           THEN u.usage_quantity * CAST(p.pricing.effective_list.default AS DOUBLE)
           ELSE 0 END) AS cost_usd,
  SUM(CASE WHEN u.usage_unit = 'DBU' THEN u.usage_quantity ELSE 0 END) AS dbu
FROM system.billing.usage u
LEFT JOIN system.billing.list_prices p
  ON u.sku_name = p.sku_name
 AND u.usage_start_time >= p.price_start_time
 AND (u.usage_start_time < p.price_end_time OR p.price_end_time IS NULL)
WHERE u.usage_unit = 'DBU'
  AND u.usage_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
GROUP BY 1,2,3

datasets.name: needs_attention_daily
queryLines:
WITH job_agg AS (
  SELECT
    job_id,
    date_trunc('day', period_start_time) AS day,
    COUNT(*) AS runs,
    AVG(CASE WHEN UPPER(result_state) = 'SUCCESS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS success_rate,
    percentile_approx(
      UNIX_TIMESTAMP(period_end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(period_start_time),
      0.95
    ) AS p95_dur
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
  WHERE period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
  GROUP BY job_id, date_trunc('day', period_start_time)
),
job_wow AS (
  SELECT
    job_id, day, success_rate, p95_dur,
    LAG(p95_dur) OVER (PARTITION BY job_id ORDER BY day) AS p95_prev
  FROM job_agg
)
SELECT
  'JOB' AS entity_type,
  CAST(job_id AS STRING) AS entity_id,
  day,
  CASE
    WHEN success_rate < 0.95 THEN 'RED'
    WHEN success_rate < 0.98 THEN 'YELLOW'
    WHEN p95_prev IS NOT NULL
         AND (p95_dur - p95_prev) / p95_prev > 0.25 THEN 'YELLOW'
    ELSE 'GREEN'
  END AS flag,
  success_rate,
  p95_dur
FROM job_wow

datasets.name: warehouse_efficiency_daily
queryLines:
WITH uptime AS (
  WITH e AS (
    SELECT
      warehouse_id,
      event_time,
      event_type,
      LEAD(event_time) OVER (PARTITION BY warehouse_id ORDER BY event_time) AS next_time
    FROM system.compute.warehouse_events
    WHERE event_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
  )
  SELECT
    warehouse_id,
    date_trunc('day', event_time) AS day,
    SUM(CASE WHEN event_type = 'RUNNING'
             THEN COALESCE(UNIX_TIMESTAMP(next_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(event_time), 0)
             ELSE 0 END) / 60 AS running_minutes
  FROM e
  GROUP BY warehouse_id, date_trunc('day', event_time)
),
q AS (
  SELECT
    compute.warehouse_id AS warehouse_id,
    date_trunc('day', start_time) AS day,
    COUNT(*) AS queries
  FROM system.query.history
  WHERE start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
  GROUP BY compute.warehouse_id, date_trunc('day', start_time)
)
SELECT
  u.warehouse_id,
  u.day,
  (u.running_minutes / 1440.0) AS running_ratio,
  COALESCE(q.queries, 0) AS queries,
  CASE
    WHEN u.running_minutes > 0 THEN
      GREATEST(0.0, 1.0 - (COALESCE(q.queries, 0) / u.running_minutes))
    ELSE 0.0
  END AS idle_ratio_est
FROM uptime u
LEFT JOIN q
  ON u.warehouse_id = q.warehouse_id
 AND u.day = q.day

datasets.name: executive_overview_rollup
queryLines:
WITH cost_data AS (
  SELECT
    SUM(CASE WHEN u.usage_unit = 'DBU'
             THEN u.usage_quantity * CAST(p.pricing.effective_list.default AS DOUBLE)
             ELSE 0 END) AS cost_usd,
    SUM(CASE WHEN u.usage_unit = 'DBU' THEN u.usage_quantity ELSE 0 END) AS dbu
  FROM system.billing.usage u
  LEFT JOIN system.billing.list_prices p
    ON u.sku_name = p.sku_name
   AND u.usage_start_time >= p.price_start_time
   AND (u.usage_start_time < p.price_end_time OR p.price_end_time IS NULL)
  WHERE u.usage_unit = 'DBU'
    AND u.usage_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
),
jobs AS (
  SELECT
    AVG(CASE WHEN UPPER(result_state) = 'SUCCESS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS job_success_rate,
    percentile_approx(
      UNIX_TIMESTAMP(period_end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(period_start_time),
      0.95
    ) AS job_p95_sec
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
  WHERE period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
),
pipelines AS (
  SELECT
    AVG(CASE WHEN UPPER(result_state) = 'SUCCESS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS pipeline_success_rate
  FROM system.lakeflow.pipeline_update_timeline
  WHERE period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
),
queries AS (
  SELECT
    percentile_approx(
      (UNIX_TIMESTAMP(end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(start_time)) * 1000,
      0.95
    ) AS query_p95_ms
  FROM system.query.history
  WHERE start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
)
SELECT
  cost_usd,
  dbu,
  cost_usd / NULLIF(dbu, 0) AS usd_per_dbu,
  job_success_rate,
  job_p95_sec,
  pipeline_success_rate,
  query_p95_ms
FROM cost_data, jobs, pipelines, queries

datasets.name: cost_per_user_3afae8
queryLines:
WITH prices AS (
  SELECT sku_name, price_start_time, price_end_time, CAST(pricing.effective_list.default AS DOUBLE) AS unit_price
  FROM system.billing.list_prices
),
usage_priced AS (
  SELECT u.identity_metadata.run_as AS user_or_sp,
         u.usage_start_time,
         u.usage_unit,
         u.usage_quantity,
         p.unit_price
  FROM system.billing.usage u
  LEFT JOIN prices p
    ON u.sku_name = p.sku_name
   AND u.usage_start_time >= p.price_start_time
   AND (u.usage_start_time < p.price_end_time OR p.price_end_time IS NULL)
  WHERE u.usage_unit = 'DBU'
    AND u.usage_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
),
agg AS (
  SELECT COALESCE(user_or_sp, 'UNKNOWN') AS user_or_sp,
         SUM(usage_quantity * unit_price) AS cost_usd,
         SUM(usage_quantity) AS dbu
  FROM usage_priced
  GROUP BY COALESCE(user_or_sp, 'UNKNOWN')
)
SELECT user_or_sp, cost_usd, dbu
FROM agg
ORDER BY cost_usd DESC
LIMIT 10

datasets.name: cost_attr_by_type_deadd9c5
queryLines:
SELECT
  CASE
    WHEN u.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL THEN 'JOB'
    WHEN u.usage_metadata.dlt_pipeline_id IS NOT NULL THEN 'PIPELINE'
    WHEN u.usage_metadata.warehouse_id IS NOT NULL THEN 'WAREHOUSE'
    ELSE 'OTHER'
  END AS object_type,
  SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN u.usage_unit = 'DBU' THEN u.usage_quantity * CAST(p.pricing.effective_list.default AS DOUBLE)
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) AS total_cost,
  SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN u.usage_unit = 'DBU' THEN u.usage_quantity
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) AS total_dbu
FROM system.billing.usage u
LEFT JOIN system.billing.list_prices p
  ON u.sku_name = p.sku_name
  AND u.usage_start_time >= p.price_start_time
  AND (u.usage_start_time < p.price_end_time OR p.price_end_time IS NULL)
WHERE u.usage_unit = 'DBU'
  AND u.usage_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
GROUP BY object_type
ORDER BY total_cost DESC

datasets.name: job_success_list_f8cec8c8
queryLines:
SELECT
  jrt.job_id,
  COALESCE(j.name, jrt.run_name) AS job_name,
  SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(jrt.result_state) = 'SUCCESS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS success_runs,
  COUNT(*) AS total_runs
FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline jrt
LEFT JOIN system.lakeflow.jobs j
  ON jrt.workspace_id = j.workspace_id
  AND jrt.job_id = j.job_id
WHERE jrt.period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
GROUP BY jrt.job_id, COALESCE(j.name, jrt.run_name)
ORDER BY success_runs DESC

datasets.name: job_failed_list_7119a80f
queryLines:
SELECT
  jrt.job_id,
  COALESCE(j.name, jrt.run_name) AS job_name,
  SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(jrt.result_state) = 'FAILED' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS failed_runs,
  COUNT(*) AS total_runs
FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline jrt
LEFT JOIN system.lakeflow.jobs j
  ON jrt.workspace_id = j.workspace_id
  AND jrt.job_id = j.job_id
WHERE jrt.period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
GROUP BY jrt.job_id, COALESCE(j.name, jrt.run_name)
ORDER BY failed_runs DESC

datasets.name: cluster_util_status_1173f2d7
queryLines:
WITH per_cluster AS (
  SELECT
    cluster_id,
    CASE
      WHEN AVG(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) > 80 THEN 'Overutilized'
      WHEN AVG(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) < 20 THEN 'Underutilized'
      ELSE 'Optimal'
    END AS utilization_status
  FROM system.compute.node_timeline
  WHERE start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
  GROUP BY cluster_id
),
counts AS (
  SELECT utilization_status, COUNT(*) AS cluster_count
  FROM per_cluster
  GROUP BY utilization_status
),
total AS (
  SELECT SUM(cluster_count) AS total_clusters FROM counts
)
SELECT
  c.utilization_status,
  c.cluster_count,
  c.cluster_count / total.total_clusters AS cluster_ratio
FROM counts c, total
ORDER BY c.utilization_status

datasets.name: job_attention_fa4e28ac
queryLines:
SELECT
  jrt.job_id,
  COALESCE(j.name, jrt.run_name) AS job_name,
  COUNT(*) AS total_runs,
  SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(jrt.result_state) = 'FAILED' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS failed_runs,
  CASE
    WHEN COUNT(*) = 0 THEN 0
    ELSE SUM(CASE WHEN UPPER(jrt.result_state) = 'FAILED' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 1.0 / COUNT(*)
  END AS failure_rate,
  percentile_approx(
    UNIX_TIMESTAMP(jrt.period_end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(jrt.period_start_time),
    0.95
  ) AS p95_duration_sec
FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline jrt
LEFT JOIN system.lakeflow.jobs j
  ON jrt.workspace_id = j.workspace_id
  AND jrt.job_id = j.job_id
WHERE jrt.period_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
GROUP BY jrt.job_id, COALESCE(j.name, jrt.run_name)
ORDER BY failure_rate DESC, p95_duration_sec DESC

datasets.name: top_jobs_by_cost_745a9c32
queryLines:
SELECT
  u.usage_metadata.job_id AS job_id,
  SUM(u.usage_quantity) AS dbu,
  SUM(u.usage_quantity * CAST(p.pricing.effective_list.default AS DOUBLE)) AS cost_usd
FROM system.billing.usage u
LEFT JOIN system.billing.list_prices p
  ON u.sku_name = p.sku_name
  AND u.usage_start_time >= p.price_start_time
  AND (u.usage_start_time < p.price_end_time OR p.price_end_time IS NULL)
WHERE u.usage_unit = 'DBU'
  AND u.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
  AND u.usage_start_time >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
GROUP BY u.usage_metadata.job_id
ORDER BY cost_usd DESC
LIMIT 10

lines:
### 📊 Dashboard Overview

This dashboard pulls directly from Databricks system tables to surface key operational metrics – cost, usage, reliability and performance – all in one place. Because it runs on your lakehouse, you get near‑real‑time data without any extract or replication step.Why it matters: having these insights at your fingertips helps you make better decisions around spend, capacity and reliability, while staying within Databricks’ native governance and security framework.

### 🧾 Business Overview Page
This page is your high‑level health check. It includes numeric tiles for Total Cost, DBUs consumed, USD per DBU, Job Success Rate, Pipeline Success Rate, Query P95 Duration and more. Beneath those tiles you’ll find the following visualizations, each occupying a full row for easy reading:

- Daily Cost and DBUs by SKU: Bar and line charts (with a SKU filter) show how consumption and spend change over time. For example, if cost climbs while DBUs remain flat, that may signal a price change or inefficiency.

- Job & Pipeline Reliability: Line charts display success rates and P95 durations, while stacked bars show run counts. You can quickly spot reliability regressions or long‑running tasks.

- Task Mix by Type: A bar chart summarizes which task types (e.g. notebooks, DLT pipelines) are used most often.

- Cost Distribution by Object Type: A pie chart breaks down spend across jobs, pipelines, warehouses and other objects, highlighting where the biggest slices of your budget go.

- Top Users by Cost: This bar chart attributes spend to individual users or service principals using the identity\_metadata.run\_as field

- Job Health Summary: A sortable table lists each job with its total runs, failed runs, failure rate and 95th‑percentile duration. Sorting by failure rate or duration makes it obvious which jobs need investigation.

All of these charts react to the global filters at the top of the page (date range and SKU), so you can drill down to a specific time period or service category.

### ⚙️ Technical & Performance Page
This page is for the practitioners – platform engineers, FinOps analysts and SREs – who need to diagnose performance issues and optimise resources. Charts include:

- Warehouse Running Ratio: Shows what percentage of each day warehouses spend in a RUNNING state, helping you assess auto‑stop and scheduling efficiency.

- Node CPU vs Memory Utilization: A scatter plot of average CPU vs. memory utilization for each cluster over the last seven days, revealing under‑ or over‑provisioned compute.

- Average CPU Usage by Hour: Highlights diurnal patterns and when clusters are most taxed.Query Performance: A scatter plot correlating query duration with rows read, plus a line chart for 95th‑percentile query duration and a bar chart of failed query counts.

- Warehouse Efficiency & Idle Ratio: Compares run time against query volumes to estimate idle time – a high idle ratio suggests over‑provisioning.

- Cluster Utilisation Status: Bar chart classifying clusters as Overutilized (>80 % CPU), Underutilized (<20 %) or Optimal, helping you target scale‑up or scale‑down actions.

- Successful vs Failed Job Runs: Two tables showing which jobs are running successfully and which are failing most often, with run counts for context.

All charts can be filtered by date range and other selectors, and clicking data points will cross‑filter the rest of the page.

### 🕹️ How to Use the DashboardUse the interactive controls to focus on what matters:

-Date & SKU Filters: Choose a time window or service SKU to narrow the scope of all charts.

-Cross‑filtering: Click on a bar or line segment to filter other charts to the same subset. For example, clicking a spike in the Query Duration vs Rows chart filters all charts to that day and reveals which jobs or pipelines caused the latency.

-Sorting & Drill‑Down: In the Job Health Summary table, sort by failure rate or P95 duration to identify problem jobs, then click the job ID to investigate further in Databricks.

Job Health SummaryShows failure rate and P95 duration for each job over the last 30 days.Sorts jobs by highest failure rate and longest P95 durations.Use this table to identify jobs that may need optimization.
